oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1942-12-05 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from December 5, 1942. Featuring Louie Buck (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Bashful Brother Oswald, Rachel Veach, Sam & Kirk McGee, Pap's Jug Band, the Crook Brothers, Robert Lunn, the John Daniel Quartet, and Mac McGar. Held at War Memorial Auditorium, Nashville, TN. Recording begins with the end of the previous Opry segment, sponsored by Carter's Chicks.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Sam & Kirk McGee; Bashful Brother Oswald; Rachel Veach; Pap's Jug Band; Crook Brothers
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Announcer closing statement -- WSM station announcement (George D. Hay) -- Opening statement (Louie Buck) -- Opening theme -- Louie Buck introduces George D. Hay -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys and Girls -- Boil Them Cabbage Down (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- George D. Hay introduces Sam & Kirk McGee -- John Henry (Sam & Kirk McGee) -- George D. Hay introduces Bashful Brother Oswald and Rachel Veach -- John Hardy (Bashful Brother Oswald, Rachel Veach) -- Prince Albert commercial (George D. Hay, Louie Buck) -- George D. Hay introduces Pap's Jug Band -- Sourwood Mountain (Pap's Jug Band) -- George D. Hay introduces the Crook Brothers -- Mississippi Sawyer (Crook Brothers)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Hay, George D.
